byline.original: Special Correspondence of the N. Y. Daily Times

headline.main: AFFAIRS AT WASHINGTON; Anticipated Debate on Central American Affairs. Gen. Cass and Ex-Secretaries Clayton and Everett. OBSERVANCE OF NEW-YEAR'S DAY THE PRESIDENT'S LEVEE PROSPECTIVE LEGISLATION IN CONGRESS, Complete List of Diplomatic Appointments, FOREIGN APPOINTMENTS,

docs.lead_paragraph: Conversation is naturally turned upon Central American affairs again, in anticipation of the debate which it is well understood will occur in the Senate after the answer to Cass' resolution shall be' sent in; and, as might be expected, some of the points likely to be presented in that debate are developing in conversational circles.

headline.main: LATER FROM EUROPE.; Arrival of the Canada at Halifax. Unchanged Aspect of the Eastern Question, BRITISH CABINET STILL INCOMPLETE. Duels of M. Soule and Son in Spain, LATER FROM INDIA AND CHINA. THE TURKISH WAR. GREAT BRITAIN. FRANCE. SPAIN. INDIA AND CHINA.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Royal Mail Steamship Canada, Capt. STONE, from Liverpool on Saturday, Dec. 24, arrived at this port at 9 o'clock this morning, en route for Boston. She brings 60 through passengers. The Collins steamship Baltic, Capt. COMSTOCK, from New-York, Dec. 10, arrived off Liverpool on the evening of Thursday, Dec. 22, but did not enter her dock until the following morning.
docs.abstract: charged with improper interference in Army affairs

headline.main: BROOKLYN CITY.; THE NEW COMMON COUNCIL. Message of Mayor Lambert. COMMITTEES. Laws. ELECTION OF OTHER OFFICERS. Corporation Counsellor

docs.lead_paragraph: The new Board of Aldermen assembled on Mon day evening, at 7 o'clock, in compliance with the requirements of the Charter, and proceeded to organize by the election of Alderman DAYTON, of the Eleventh Ward, Chairman pro tem. headline.main: MEXICO.; MANIFESTO. ANTONIO LOPEZ DE SANTA ANNA.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Dictniorship Annamed by Santa Anna. New-Orleans papers of the 26th bring further in telligence from Mexico. On the 10th of December SAN TA ANNA issued a decree declaring: 1. That the President should prolong his power as long as he might deem necessary: 2. That he should appoint his own successor: 3. That his title should be "Most Serene Highness." headline.main: Munificent Donations to Union College--Dr, Nott Vindicated.
NEW-YORK CITY.; COMMON COUNCIL PROCEEDINGS. Swearing in of the New Common Council--Message from His Honor the Mayor. MESSAGE OF THE MAYOR. Board of Councilmen. FIRES. SESSIONS CALENDAR.

docs.lead_paragraph: A large number of persons assembled in the Chamber of the Board of Aldermen on Monday, to witness the ceremony of swearing in the "Reform" members. At 12 o'clock, the Clerk, Mr. D. T. VALENINE, called over the roll. As each member answered, he stood forward in the centre of the room, and took the oath of office from his Honor the Mayor, in the following order:

docs.lead_paragraph: DEATH OF REV. LEWIS WELD.--We regret to learn, through the Hartford Courant, of the death of Rev. LEWIS WELD, Principal of the American Asylum for the Deaf and Dumb at Hartford, Conn. Mr. WELD was an earnest and efficient worker in the cause of Deaf Mute education, and the members of the venerable Institution lately under his care sustain a heavy loss in his decease.
